69.09 TRUCK, BOAT, AND TRAILER PARKING.
It shall be unlawful to park a truck of over three-quarter ton, manufacturer’s
rated capacity, or to park any converted bus, truck-tractor, trailer or
semitrailer, or boat, on any street or public alley in the City; provided, that
this section does not apply to trucks, semitrailer, or trailer being used for
the purpose of delivering or collecting goods, wares, merchandise for longer
than is necessary for the expeditious delivery or collection thereof, and in no
event for a period of time to exceed three hours, nor does it apply to trucks,
semitrailers, or trailers being used in construction; and provided further,
that no trucks of three-quarter ton or less, manufacturer’s rated capacity,
carrying livestock shall park at any time on the following streets:
1.   Main Street from Maple Street to Quarry Street.
2.   Olive Street from East Pleasant Street to East Quarry Street.
3.   Platt Street (U.S. Highway 64) from Second Street to Eliza Street.
4.   Pleasant Street from South Niagara Street to South Eliza Street.
5.   Pleasant Street from South Second Street to Olive Street.
69.10 PARKING LIMITED.
It shall hereafter be illegal for any person to park any vehicle on the
following streets.
1.   Monday through Friday between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.:
   A.   Main Street, from Maple Street to Quarry Street.
   B.   Olive Street, from East Maple Street to East Quarry Street.
   C.   Platt Street (U.S. Highway 64), from Second Street to Olive Street.
   D.   Pleasant Street, from South Second Street to South Olive Street.
   E.   Second Street, from West Maple Street to West Quarry Street.
   F.   West Maple Street, from South Second Street to South Main Street.
2.   Mondays through Fridays between the hours of 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
   A.   North side of West Summit Street between South Main Street and South
Second Street.
3.   For more than two hours:
   A.   Monday through Saturday between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m.
Maple Street on the south side from Otto Street to a point 300 feet east of the
east line of Clark Street on.
   B.   Monday through Friday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. on
the 100 block of East Quarry Street on the north and south sides.
   C.   South Clark Street on the west side from East Maple Street to East
Pleasant Street.
4.   For a period of time of more than 15 minutes
   A.   In front of 102 North Otto Street.
69.11 SNOW REMOVAL.
No person shall park, abandon or leave unattended any vehicle on any public
street, alley, or City-owned off-street parking area during snow removal
operations unless the snow has been removed or plowed from said street, alley
or parking area and the snow has ceased to fall.
(Code of Iowa, 321.236[1])
69.12 SNOW ROUTES.
The Council may designate certain streets in the City as snow routes. When
conditions of snow or ice exist on the traffic surface of a designated snow
route, it is unlawful for the driver of a vehicle to impede or block traffic.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 321.236[12])
69.13 FIRE LANES.
No person shall stop, stand, or park a vehicle in a fire lane as provided
herein.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 321.236)
1.   Fire Lanes Established. The Fire Chief may designate fire lanes on any
private road or driveway where deemed necessary to assure access to property or
premises by authorized emergency vehicles.
2.   Signs and Markings. Wherever a fire lane has been designated, the Fire
Chief shall cause appropriate signs and markings to be placed identifying such
fire lanes and the parking prohibition established by this section.
3.   Exception. The provisions of this section do not apply to authorized
emergency vehicles.
69.14 CONTROLLED ACCESS FACILITIES.
Parking restrictions on controlled access facilities are as specified in
Chapter 140 of this Code of Ordinances.
69.15 SNOW REMOVAL EMERGENCY.
A snow removal emergency shall be deemed to exist after an accumulation of
three inches or more of snow, or after declaration of a snow removal emergency
by a public radio announcement, and shall be deemed to continue for a period of
24 hours thereafter unless such period of time shall be shortened or extended
by declaration of the Director of Public Works or City Manager through a public
radio announcement.
1.   It shall be unlawful for any person to park or leave unattended or
unoccupied any vehicle upon a designated snow route within the City, during the
existence of a snow removal emergency.
2.   On streets of the City, it shall be unlawful for any person to park or
leave unattended or unoccupied any vehicle in a parking place that has not been
cleared of snow.
3.   The parking restrictions in Subsections 1 and 2, shall be inapplicable to
vehicles parked upon a street within a City block in any designated snow route
that has been cleared of snow from curb to curb, for the entire length of the
block.
4.   Any vehicle parked or left unattended upon a designated snow route in
violation of this chapter may be towed or removed at its owner’s expense
through police authorization, and the owner of any vehicle parked or left
unattended in violation of this chapter shall be subject to fine for illegal
parking.
69.16 SNOW ROUTE DESIGNATED.
The following public streets within the City are hereby designated official
snow routes, and shall be so identified by signs conforming to State Department
of Transportation guidelines:
1.   East Maple Street from South Main Street to Jacobsen Drive.
2.   Ehlers Lane.
3.   Grove Street from North Arcade Street to North Walnut Street.

7.   Myatt Drive from City limits to West Summit Street.
8.   Niagara Street from West Grove Street to West Monroe Street.
9.   North Arcade from West Platt Street (U.S. Highway 64) to West Grove
Street.
10.   Olive Street from East Quarry Street to East Pleasant Street.
11.   Pershing Road from Main Street to east corporate limits.
12.   Platt Street (U.S. Highway 64) from west City limits to Jacobsen Drive.
13.   Pleasant Street from South Niagara Street to South Olive Street.
14.   Quarry Street from North Arcade Street to North Walnut Street.

Road.
